channel.title: Staff
channel.description: There are so many inactive staff members, so should you not start demoting Staff that have not been on for quite a long time? It seems quite ridiculous that you do not do this. Discuss.

item.title: Staff
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Ix Soulcist xI, post:36, topic:425789”][quote author=tL link=topic=528453.msg3860433#msg3860433 date=1324621235]
Usually people request their topic to be locked because it has served a purpose, rarely do people request it when there is a healthy discussion going on, or the topic has potential for healthy discussion.

Often, it seems moderators just deny the requests for no real reason other than what appears to be yet another way to show people what extra power they have over them on the forum.
[/quote]
Including the fact that when a thread is requested to be lock, that member is more than likely to create another thread instead of going back to the one he started. And not to mention that it’ll be more work on the moderators if the thread starts to get out of hand and the staff team want more discussion within threads going on but when that thread is starting to be spammed to death, it’ll be more work on the moderators like I said.[/quote]

That makes no sense. Any topic has the “potential to be spammed to death.” We don’t lock threads that others may fine useful to respond to. If someone asks for help on something and it is solved, someone a year or two later might have a need to ask further questions. If anyone here is familiar with most other forums which actually function well, this is how it’s done.

If the user goes ahead and deletes their OP, though, I’ll still lock/delete it because obviously there’s nothing that can be done. Sometimes I personally will satisfy the request to lock if I don’t believe further discussion can happen, but this is up to each staff member anyway.

Read full topic

item.title: Staff
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

[quote=“tL, post:34, topic:425789”]Usually people request their topic to be locked because it has served a purpose, rarely do people request it when there is a healthy discussion going on, or the topic has potential for healthy discussion.

Often, it seems moderators just deny the requests for no real reason other than what appears to be yet another way to show people what extra power they have over them on the forum.[/quote]
Including the fact that when a thread is requested to be lock, that member is more than likely to create another thread instead of going back to the one he started. And not to mention that it’ll be more work on the moderators if the thread starts to get out of hand and the staff team want more discussion within threads going on but when that thread is starting to be spammed to death, it’ll be more work on the moderators like I said.

Read full topic

item.title: Staff
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:33, topic:425789”][quote author=tL link=topic=528453.msg3859484#msg3859484 date=1324588354]
It’s a left over “rule” from the times where the staff thought this place needed fascist moderators. It’s boswollocks.
[/quote]

Huh? I consider it the complete opposite. Locking stuff all the time is a fascist thing to do. We’re trying to encourage continual discussion later on by not locking topics all the time. Makin no sense thug. :P[/quote]

Usually people request their topic to be locked because it has served a purpose, rarely do people request it when there is a healthy discussion going on, or the topic has potential for healthy discussion.

Often, it seems moderators just deny the requests for no real reason other than what appears to be yet another way to show people what extra power they have over them on the forum.

Read full topic

item.title: Staff
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Classic_, post:22, topic:425789”][quote author=ytuio9` link=topic=528453.msg3856697#msg3856697 date=1324403885]
Obviously no gun laws are what made this community need no moderating
Also mopman
[/quote]
Lol’d. But seriously, its not harm done but there accounts COULD get hacked, right? So it would be better to demote them.
Also mopman[/quote]

A moderator can do no real damage, even if the account is compromised, because I have code in place to roll back everything a moderator can do.

It used to be that an Administrator could do irreversible damage, but now, thanks to mopman, all that is nicely patched up too. So there is no reason to remove inactive staff members if they have done nothing wrong and can come back and help here and there.

Read full topic

item.title: Staff
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

Taharok:

The only minus I see in keeping inactive staff members is the sheer possibility their accounts get compromised. But in all honesty, that’s stretching it quite a bit. In the opposite extreme, a plus is the possibility they come back to contribute someday. Both arguments are weak, so it’s easy to just say “no harm done, why change it?”

Don’t worry. That only happens to Mopman. And he’s not even inactive :\

Read full topic
